iti41:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti41:2.1_0: “Those sentient beings are truly bereft, mendicants, who are bereft of noble wisdom.
iti41:2.2_0: They live unhappily in the present life—with distress, anguish, and fever—
iti41:2.3_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.
iti41:2.4_0: Those sentient beings are not bereft who are not bereft of noble wisdom.
iti41:2.5_0: In the present life they’re happy—free of anguish, distress, and fever—
iti41:2.6_0: When the body breaks up, after death, they can expect to be reborn in a good place.”
iti41:4.1_0: Wisdom is best in the world,
iti41:4.4_0: the ending of rebirth and continued existence.
iti41:6.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
